Napoleon of India

Historian V.A. Smith called him the 'Napoleon of India' due to his extensive military conquests. His court poet Harisena's 'Prayag Prashasti' (Allahabad Pillar inscription) provides a detailed account of his victories.

ЁЯП╣
Military Campaigns

He defeated 9 kings of Aryavarta (North India) and 12 kings of Dakshinapatha (South India). Towards the kings of the South, he adopted the policy of 'Grahaс╣Зa-moksha-anugraha' (conquer, release, and show favor).

ЁЯОи
Kaviraja and Music Lover

He himself was a great poet and musician. He is depicted playing the veena on his coins and held the title 'Kaviraja'.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Titles: Kaviraja, Ashwamedha-Parakrama, Sarvarajochheta (destroyer of all kings), Paramabhagavata.
  • Inscriptions: Prayag Prashasti (Allahabad), Eran Inscription.
  • Coins: Garuda, Archer, Parashu, Ashwamedha, Vyaghra-hanta, Veena-player types.
  • Contemporary: King Meghavarman of Sri Lanka requested permission to build a monastery in Bodh Gaya.
